---
title: "GAUSSIAN PROCESS MODELING IN R"
---

Gaussian Processes (GP) are used for probabilistic modeling of unknown functions.

Here is a simple example in R:

```{r}
# Load library
library(MASS)

# Example data
x <- seq(-5, 5, length.out = 20)
y <- sin(x) + rnorm(20, 0, 0.2)

# RBF Kernel function
rbf_kernel <- function(x1, x2, l=1){
  exp(- (outer(x1, x2, "-")^2) / (2*l^2))
}

K <- rbf_kernel(x, x) + 0.01 * diag(20)

# Simulate from the Gaussian Process
y_sim <- mvrnorm(1, mu = rep(0, 20), Sigma = K)

# Plot
plot(x, y, main="Gaussian Process Example", xlab="x", ylab="y")
lines(x, y_sim, col="blue")
```
